publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1657 Rob Gibson: European Maritime Day—That the Parliament welcomes the introduction of an annual European Maritime Day to be instituted on 20 May 2008 to celebrate Europe’s maritime heritage and marine-related issues; further recognises the vital role that the marine environment plays in the past, present and future of Scotland, and calls on the Scottish Government to help mark the day with events to highlights its importance.

S3M-1657 Rob Gibson: European Maritime Day—That the Parliament welcomes the introduction of an annual European Maritime Day to be instituted on 20 May 2008 to celebrate Europe’s maritime heritage and marine-related issues; further recognises the vital role that the marine environment plays in the past, present and future of Scotland, and calls on the Scottish Government to help mark the day with events to highlights its importance.
S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Michael Matheson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Joe FitzPatrick*
S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Bob Doris*

S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Stuart McMillan*, Helen Eadie*, Christina McKelvie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Patrick Harvie*, Alasdair Allan*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Tavish Scott*, Bill Kidd*, Keith Brown*, Gil Paterson*, Brian Adam*, Elaine Smith*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Robin Harper*, Bashir Ahmad*, Bill Wilson* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Andrew Welsh*
S3M-1657 European Maritime Day (lodged on 27 March 2008) Dave Thompson* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
